title: TERMINATE WINTER RYE COVER CROPS WITH THIS HACK!

tasks.task: Prepare a garden bed using winter rye cover crop as sheet mulch.
subtasks: Mark bed boundaries using T-posts and rope.
Crimp the winter rye with a T-post tool.
Apply a silage tarp over the crimped cover crop.
Water the tarp area to facilitate weed termination.
Remove tarp after the desired period (e.g., 1-2 weeks).
Spread compost and wood chips on the prepared bed.
Smooth compost and fill gaps with wood chips for even mulch coverage.

tasks.task: Harvest existing crops before transitioning to new planting.
subtasks: Hoe out any remaining weeds in the garden bed.
Measure out the prepared bed for new crop planting.
Plant habanero peppers in the sheet mulched bed.
Fill in gaps with wood chips.
Regularly check and replenish wood chips as needed.
Remove harvested crops to maintain garden aesthetics and prevent weed regrowth.
